result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Paul F. Rizzo was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant, Paul F. Rizzo appeared with Attorney Matthew Curtiss Lein.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.
11:33 am Court recites case & app; Cases 15 CF 78, 101 & 102; plea ? tendered - pleading to OWI 5th in 15 CF 78, 15 CF 101, 102 Dismissed, fine $4,153.00, DL rev 36 mo, AL assess, victim impact, IID, home detention 350 days w/credit for time served and good time.   DA - concurs w/agreement, guidelines case except w/home detention.  Atty L - IID exception due to hardship.  Court - ?'s; Atty L - no vehicle or valid DL.   Deft - concurs.  Court - ?'s; Deft 14 CF 78 - deft pleads no contest; deft understands const. rights; Atty L - statements; Court ?'s deft; deft - statements; Court - finds no collateral attack, counsel represented deft in prior cases; DA - statement; Court - cont. const. rights recited, firearm, may not vote, etc.; Atty L - statement; Deft - nothing further; Atty L - statement; Court finds factual basis, finds deft understands const. rights, finds deft guilty of OWI 5th; DA - adopt plea agreement; Atty L - concurs, request once again no IID required; Court - IID case hardship?  Atty L - statement.  Court - file form with DOT stating no vehicles owned but can't remove condition but can reduce financial obligation; Atty L - not order installing IID due to financial hardship; Court - file form w/DOT stating no vehicles owned; Atty L - will obtain form; Deft - statements; 
COURT: adopts plea agreement, fine $4,153, set up payment plan, DL rev 36 mo., AODA, attend victim impact panel, IID, serve 350 days jail and if approved by sheriff can accomplish by electronic monitoring, eligible for good time, credit for 11 days, provide DNA sample to sheriff dept.  Apppellate rgts.  Adj'd 12:08 pm
12:09 pm Back on record.  15 CF 101 and 102 dismissed.   Adj'd 12:09 p.m.
